verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments, set to the Sheminith. A Psalm of David. O <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>, <S%H3198>rebuke<s%> me not in thine <S%H639>anger<s%>, Neither <S%H3256>chasten<s%> me in thy hot <S%H2534>displeasure<s%>.
Have <S%H2603>mercy<s%> upon <S%H3068>me<s%>, O Jehovah; for I am <S%H536>withered<s%> <S%H3068>away<s%>: O Jehovah, <S%H7495>heal<s%> <S%H6106>me<s%>; for my bones are <S%H926>troubled<s%>.
My <S%H5315>soul<s%> also is <S%H3966>sore<s%> <S%H926>troubled<s%>: And <S%H3068>thou<s%>, O Jehovah, how long?
Return <S%H7725><s%>, O <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>, <S%H2502>deliver<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%>: <S%H3467>Save<s%> me for thy <S%H2617>lovingkindness<s%>' sake.
For in <S%H4194>death<s%> there is no <S%H2143>remembrance<s%> of <S%H7585>thee<s%>: In Sheol who shall give thee <S%H3034>thanks<s%>?
I am <S%H3021>weary<s%> with my <S%H585>groaning<s%>; Every <S%H3915>night<s%> make I my <S%H4296>bed<s%> to <S%H7811>swim<s%>; I <S%H4529>water<s%> my <S%H4296>couch<s%> with my <S%H1832>tears<s%>.
Mine <S%H5869>eye<s%> <S%H6244>wasteth<s%> away because of <S%H3708>grief<s%>; It waxeth <S%H6275>old<s%> because of all mine <S%H6887>adversaries<s%>.
Depart <S%H5493><s%> from <S%H6466>me<s%>, all ye workers of <S%H205>iniquity<s%>; For <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> hath <S%H8085>heard<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H1065>weeping<s%>.

All mine <S%H341>enemies<s%> shall be put to <S%H954>shame<s%> and <S%H3966>sore<s%> <S%H926>troubled<s%>: They shall turn <S%H7725>back<s%>, they shall be put to <S%H954>shame<s%> <S%H7281>suddenly<s%>.
